page.title: 07EDUCATION: DANE END & AREA
page.content: {LITTLE MUNDEN JMI SCHOOL}was founded in 1819 by the Rev. J. Reynolds and classes were held in the gallery on the north aisle of the church. The school building was extended in 1869, 1900, 1957, 1970 and 1973. There are now 135 children between the ages of 5-11 years with five full time teachers, including the Headteacher and one part-time teacher. The children come from{Dane End, Green {End, Great Munden, Haultwick, Libury {Hall, Rush Green, Rowney Priory, {Nasty, Sacombe, Sacombe Green, Potters {Green}and{Whempstead.}They come on foot, by car, taxi and coach. Some children leave at 9 years to go into the Middle School system in Puckeridge and Buntingford. The majority leave at 11 years and go to schools in Hertford, Ware and Bishop Stortford.
